reviews_data.review_text:
What a place. If you love (or want to try) play tabletop games this place is a must go. Very friendly players (and staff). Everyone were playing different games (Skyrim, Warhammer, Magic The Gathering, and a Star Wars), and they have a lot more for sale (even games I have not heard before). Newbies are welcome and they host tournaments for the experienced players. They have drafted beer  too.

* I didn't take pictures of the tables for respect of the pleople playing, but they have many of them. You will find one that is playing something cool you know (or even better something new).
Carolina Tabletop Games is an awesome place to play games with friends. They have beer on tap plus from local breweries and friendly staff!
Rude employee. Lost a customer. I'll defineatly drive out of my way or just play online.

I'm a magic player and beer lover and this shop is super cool. Very friendly staff and a good selection of packs, singles, and precons. Also, the commons and uncommons in their bulk are free!

There is also a wide selection of board games and lots of TTRPG books and such.
Excellent place for tabletop gaming. Has Collectable card games, board games, miniatures available and good space. Adult beverages also available

Carolina Tabletop Games, though cozy, brims with warmth. The staff here are absolute gems, offering friendly smiles and a helping hand with any game-related questions. It creates a truly inviting atmosphere, perfect for browsing. While the selection might not be vast, the friendly faces make it a delightful spot for gamers who value a warm welcome.

I was shown CTTG from another tabletop wargaming friend and have been visiting this store for a couple weeks now.

Rob and Kris are fantastic! They're great to interact with across a multitude of scenarios. I've reserved tables, purchased and preordered Warhammer, played a couple games and enjoyed the drinks they have on draft.

This place has turned into a favorite of mine and I absolutely plan on visiting more going forward.
Awesome game shop and place to play ttrpgs
A bit of a small place, but welcoming enough.

Just stopped in today to see what they have as my wife and I are just getting into board games, and was absolutely blown away! Great selection and amazing store owner! He was able to point me in the right direction and picked out some really cool games! Will definitely be back soon to get some more!

Been visiting this shop since it opened.  Great community of players of so many games, and a HUGE Magic community.

Friday night is always great for commander.

Come in and play and enjoy a draft beer!
Great place to play MTG, D&D, WH 40K or any board game.  Owner and staff are super friendly!
Amazing!
Friendly staff, solid selection (of games and drinks) and awesome community! Great to see it packed today!
Can play board games there
I always have a great time playing commander on Saturdays!
The ideal example of a game store. Great games and super friendly staff.
Great small nerd gamer store
Great staff good prices
Great store staffed by great folks with IMO the best atmosphere in the Charlotte area. Pull up if you're trying to play boardgames, Warhammer, or magic the gathering or getting supplies to play them!
Great people. Bought some magic cards and got a lot of help. Good environment highly recommend. But if you're going to play magic you better have the cards because these guys bring the heat.
Nice place to meet with friends for a table top game as well as a good place to find new table top games to try out.
great, friendly place

Really cute place. They have a nice selection of paints and minis. A monstrous assortment of board games. Really fun dice and various pluahies and geeky merch. The atmosphere was homey. The store is kinda small, and it was packed with people playing games, though there was a back room for gaming also. Everyone was friendly and nice. Parking was a bit annoying, but that's to be expected in the middle of town. I really liked it here and will go back.
Well organized game store. Very nice selection  , which was a surprise. Everything is marked MSRP , so it's very expensive to buy board games here.

Extremely overpriced on all RPG and TCG products. Any MTG prerelease event is not up to standard. Best of 1 is not prerelease standard. If you are comfortable paying $35+ for a standard prerelease with best of 1 elimination and minimal prizeout, power to you. If you want to pay $50+ for the D&D 5e Player's Handbook, all the better, but I've taken my business elsewhere. There are many great shops in the area that do not price gouge their customers.
Unbelievable! Fun for free!!!

This place is great and the
people are very friendly.
10/10 shop best place to play magic commander! Friendly shop owner always up for a game
Great place to hang out and have fun!  Rob, the owner, has an amazing  setup!  I love the eclectic group of people who frequent this tavern like game store.  Everyone is very welcoming!
Awesome as always.

Came in to Charlotte for the weekend and had a great time playing pick up magic the gathering commander games Friday and Saturday Nights. They have a discord to help organize gaming communities for each of the product lines they support which was helpful finding players for Saturday night. Their commander nights are Monday and Friday and it seems like they fire multiple pods and all the players and the staff were super friendly and helpful. They have additional tables in the back that are large enough to support D&D and multiple table top games and they carry a huge stock of boardgames, D&D books, minis, dice, paints, Warhammer 40k, and even have drinks including draft and canned beer.

This is a great spot for gaming in Charlotte and was one of the highlights of the weekend!
My 10 yr old son is interested in learning how to play magic. The folks here were patient and gave him a few tips not only with magic but also with Pokemon.
I love this place. Great atmosphere. We were newbies. The gentleman was so nice and patient. It was the first time I went there and will definitely go there again.

One of the best community spots we've ever come across! We spent the evening playing Magic for the first time. Rob, the owner, is so welcoming and friendly and everyone there was accommodating. It's right on the Main Street strip, so it's a very cute and accessible location. And the vibe in the shop is so uplifting and communal. This place is a treasure to the community!
Nice selection for a smaller store. Surprising number of tables for different types of games. Staff was attentive and friendly.

Great place for tabletop game enthusiasts. The owner is very friendly, helpful, and engaging. Clean, great atmosphere. They carry a broad selection of inventory. I stop by just to check out the inventory sometimes, otherwise to pick up miniature paints and games.

Excited to spend more time here.

Seriously, go here. Here you can rent a table to play a game. You can play one they have, buy one they have or bring your own. They have snacks, drinks and draft beer. The staff is great and the people are super cool.
This place is amazing, everytime I visit, something is happening. If you live near pineville, visit at least once.

I always look forward to Monday Night Magic. This store has a great staff and a caring owner. The store is clean, offers a huge selection of games to buy or rent, and provides a friendly atmosphere for all age groups.

They have been very open to customer feedback and continue to evolve in to a better and better store.

Likely the most active spot in downtown pineville on Monday, Friday, and Saturdays.

The store owner Rob is such a great guy. Great selection of board games, amazing and friendly MTG community, lots of Warhammer products. Plus they got draft beer so Hands down is one of the best spot to nerd out and meet great people.

Just an amazing store with a great atmosphere and open nerd culture. There are always friendly people and the owner/shop keepers are always willing to help, and even play a game with you if you want to learn. Tables are reasonably priced and there are online groups to join if you want to play. Best of all they have beer on tap!

Walking in might make you think you landed in Land of the Nerds but they have a great array of board games. New and used! People tend to keep to themselves in little groups and I can understand why now. Once you're immersed in the throes of a game, it's hard to be distracted by anything external. Worth checking out if you're a board game enthusiast!

It's not bad! They have good stuff there from a board game perspective. Lots of space to play games whether it's Pokemon, MTG, or even Warhammer. Staff is friendly. I think cleanliness could just use a tad bit of adjustment. I noticed a cat roaming around when I went in there once, and the smell was pretty strong. However, I don't want it to seem like I disliked the place. Going in there to grab paints, pick up some cards, or just browse was totally fine :)

This is a fantastic place to find unique games, card games, and tabletop gaming gear. They provide both standing and sitting tables that allow for patrons to coordinate and play tabletop games. They allow food and beverages to be brought in to consume. They also offer a few alcoholic beverages on tap, along with non-alcoholic beverages from a cooler behind the counter.

The prices are fair and it is a good, local business that you should be proud to supoort. They offer a discord channel to help people connect with other gamers to game with. The staff is always friendly, kind, and willing to share any information they have about any of the games they have or know about. They help you connect with artists in the community or businesses you might be looking for. If you have a specific game purchase request, they will order it for you if they have access to it and they provide updates to you by phone calls to let you know the progress.

My one truly critical observation is that there is an extremely pungent and sharp odor similar to a men's locker room that is difficult to ignore. The odor hits you immediately upon opening the doors and it is very powerful. If you are sensitive to strong odors, this may be something to consider. This can be controlled by shampooing the carpets regularly or even removing the carpets that trap most of that odor and simply allowing the concrete to be on the floor.

Carolina Tabletop is a delightful passion business.  Owned and operated by a local, the staff is cordial and knowledgeable.  Draft beer and a cozy atmosphere combined with a large game room in the back for wargaming makes this a perfect place to get together for anything from Pathfinder to Age of Sigmar.
Great local store! Went in for some card sleeves and was able to get what I needed right away! Great board game selection too! Will definitely return in the future.
Great vibes, nice dice selection. Came out with a metal dice set for my wife because she was drooling over them.
Great place with friendly people.
Great local game store.

My kid is just getting into Warhammer so we stopped by to check this place out.
Lots of fun games. A pile of people playing games on a Monday night.

Owner Rob is really nice. He gave me a quick intro to the place while I waited on a friend to show. The prices are really reasonable to sit and play ($5 for the table, not per person), and I love that there's beer on tap, water bottles and soda, plus snacks (chips and sweets) available. I can't wait to come back!
Great selection. Friendly owner. Beverages and snacks available. Well lit, clean and lots of tables. Try before you buy program. Unisex restroom. Can be very lively and cozy.
Absolutely LOVE this store. So many different types of games and the staff can be very helpful finding certain types of games and explaining them.
Absolute perfection!
Very helpful and patient explaining the card game that my kid is interested in. Had exactly what was wanted and made great suggestions. Highly recommend.
Such a cute spot!
Friendly staff and active community for all things gaming.

Absolutely love this place. I visited last night for the fourth time, and its always great. Staff are so friendly and helpful. Its the best place to bring a few friends and find a table and have a blast. Also love that they have beer on tap and in cans for those who enjoy a drink as they play. Thanks yall

Rachel was great, she gave me and the fam a lot of great info on game nights and products.  Friendly, welcoming place with a super chill vibe and an awesome array of board games. Found a few things I needed for DnD nights, looking forward to coming back.

Not a large venue, but they have beer on tap which is a big plus.    There is a room in the back for miniatures based games but I did not have an opportunity to get a good look at it.  People were friendly.  Will definitely be back.
What a cool place! They have games you can try, buy (D&D, Magic The Gathering etc) and you can bring your own. They serve BEER and non alcoholic beverages. Check it out.
Don't bother, don't want my money i won't give you any.  No parking, had to park 2 blocks away.

They have a great selection of some really fun games. Plus the service was great. I enjoy a place that offers service especially when great service is hard to find in these day after covid! Thank you for having great service! I'll be back for sure!
Lots of interesting Games bought a unstoppable unicorn Game ... very fun game
New to the area and the staff and patrons here make you feel instantly at home. Really sociable place with their own discord server to help you connect to and meet fellow gamers.

An excellent place to play games and have fun! The vibe is great the people are nice and fun to hang around with. I always have a great time here and they have a great selection of board games and CCG's

A wonderful store with wonderful people. My wife and I were trying to kill some time waiting for a friend at the nearby airport and it was a great use of a few hours. The woman working there (I feel bad I forgot her name) was kind, professional, and knowledgable. I wish I lived closer so I could visit this place more often.
Finally I visited. Awesome place! We will definitely be back.
Super cool people.  Nice store

Cool hangout spot and vibe.

Tons of board games sold. Tailored for the board game enthusiasts really. Don't come here if you're looking to buy Monopoly. Come here to find your hard-to-find games.

Plenty of tables to play games with local beer on tap.

I love just hanging out here. Often it seems you can just start up a game with other people who walk in just for fun. Not a huge beer menu, but there's also another bar right beside them where you could hop to on a game break

These guys were super helpful and welcoming when I brought my whole family in when I bought some items - they aren't all into specialty gaming, but abide my hobby :)

I really appreciated the welcoming atmosphere and the way the employees were happy to jump off their game for a few minutes to help and check us out. It seems like a great place to play games, too, but I live too far away to come regularly.
Came back on a visit back home. Love this place. One of the few places you can have a drink while you DnD
Super friendly and helpful staff. Wish I'd come in for more than paints. Can't wait to make it back.
A great place to game and hang out. Beer on Tap and Soft drinks as well.
Nice quaint gaming store.  Room enough to play, even though its a little cramped.  A little bit of everything it seems.  Found a hard to find rulebook there.  Owner was very friendly.
NERD HEAVEN. I've been to a few tabletop and game shops, and this one is one of the best I've been to. AMAZING.
Great Store, Friendly People, and Great Selection! Asked a question via their Facebook page and was promptly replied too. Will definitely revisit next time im in the area!
They have GW and Reaper paints as well as a few basing materials from army painter.
Friendly & professional. This store is great for anyone who enjoys board gaming and miniatures. Very a good selection. Reasonably priced.
Neat little place in downtown Pineville. Best place to park is City Hall.
Great store good prices and very helpful staff!!! Going back soon!!
Best game store around. If you haven't checked it out already you absolutely should!
We go here often and the staff is always polite! Great atmosphere and very diverse. Lots to choose from!
What a fantastic local game store! I love that they have beer taps, too. Awesome selection of games and very friendly staff.
Really awesome game store with a super kind staff, a great selection of games, and it's always very clean.
Great store and awesome staff!
Staff was extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. Will definitely make this our family's go to for games!
A nice little store, has a good variety of games, D&D, and pathfinder items.  Will have Pathfinder Second Edition material in August!

What an amazing store and friendly staff. The fact that you can have some beers with your friends while playing tabletop games is just amazing! They also have beer on tap and that changes out occasionally. They sell Snacks and local food will deliver as well. There is an addition to the store with tables large enough for full warhammer 40k skirmishes and smaller tables for board games, card games or whatever you fancy! The store shelves are stocked with tabletop games, a must visit!

Has just about anything you could need for table top games! Lots of board games available, handbooks, dice, minis, paint, and more! Books and games are just as expensive as they are anywhere else though, don't expect a big bargin.
Friendly Staff. Decent selection of games. Room to play games. Worth stopping by.
Nice little selection of just about anything. have the necessities.
I've been once with a couple of other people and I really like the store, it's really cool and they have a ton of games.
Great spot, super relaxed. Decent selection on product. A bit small though, could get crowded quickly.
Huge crowd of gamers for Wednesday night. I came in from out of state on a business trip and found a random group to play a few games. Had an amazing time
Great Games, Great Drinks, and Great People.
I will always support Carolina Table Games! The staff is super friendly and welcoming to EVERYONE. Great selection of games, good prices.
Staff friendly and attentive. Always tables open for people to play games. Plenty of games, books and accessories available, but a little overpriced

Another successful trip to my friendly local game store! Their selection on hand always up to par, customer service always willing to help out, and not to mention the craft beer on tap. If you're looking for a local hot spot or something new to try, definitely swing by and check it out!
Awesome place to find a game, relax, and have a great time. Awesome selection of games, snacks, and drinks.
Matt was awesome and gave us great service! He suggested a large selection of games for my husband and I that I know we will enjoy. We will definitely be back for more!

Great local gaming store.  They have all sorts of games from card games to board games to RPGs to mini games.  The staff is nice and they even sell beer.  Best game store in the south west side of the Charlotte.
Great atmosphere, friendly and knowledgeable people. Can not recommend enough.
Very friendly staff. One of the few game stores that isn't becoming more and more devoted to Magic fans to everyone else's detriment.

This is a great game store! The owner and staff are always very helpful.They have a good selection of games, including a game library where you can test something out for a small fee. They have a lot of table space, and you can usually find a place to play even on busy weekends. Some of the tables are taller and better suited to miniature games or RPGs and they have some terrain that can be used for these as well. They serve a variety of craft beers from local breweries and several different snacks.
Friendly, but quite pricy compared to other shops I've been in.
Great people. Good place to interact and have fun with fellow tabletop game fans
Amazing service. The people that run this place really love what they do.
Friendly, knoweldgeable staff, excellent gaming space, beer on tap, great variety of games. This place is ideal for a games night or a RP group meetup. Parking is close and free. Enjoy!
Great place for board games! Check it out

Great place for some table top games. The staff was great and even offered an power cord to our table so we could video call a friend who could not make it in person. The adult drinks were reasonably priced. It did get somewhat noisy when we were there friday evening but that's to be expected when all the tables were full.

This is a fantastic place for nerds of all types to gather and play games together. There is a wide selection of board games, card games, model building tools, and I believe a selection of manuals for RPG such as DnD.

Admission is $5 for a group (not sure of how many people per group) which is exchanged for a token. These can be collected and put toward the purchase of one of the games.

Very friendly staff, snacks and drinks available for purchase inside. I would recommend this place!

Could look a bit shabby but dont let that stop you from hanging out with your friends and play some games, drink some beer, order some food from many options around the area. $5 cover charge per group. They have some snacks. Call in to see how busy they are.
Great people and staff. If you want to hang out and just have fun. This is the place to go.
Good selection. Fun place to play games. There's a bar so it leans towards an older crowd.
Great place. All the players are cool and they have beer on tap.
I love this shop! I always find something new. And it's a great place to play with some super friendly people!

It's a tabletop game store!! Great selection instead of multiple copies of their games. Wide selection of Miniatures for D&D, not many dice selections. A few tables to play on! Was there over half an hour browsing on the first visit.
Nice people, great staff, excellent selection of gaming
Great selection
Excellent service and selection.
Very nice place, super friendly, received many excellent recommendations.
Awesome people lots of games
Family feeling, lots of games, welcoming, non judgmental, good drinks and lots of space.
Even better since the expansion. Love going here with my friends to play games

Great, friendly, and knowledgeable staff. Games options=awesome.
A definite visit for game night options

This is my home away from home. I try to be here as much as possible. Came in on a whim after my old board game group fell apart, and immediately made good friends that have lasted for a year now. This is easily the best game store in Charlotte.
What a great shop and hangout. Try out some new games, drink some cold beer, and take home something for your collection!

Pretty sizable store, several tables to play board games as well as war games in the back.  Quite a large demo section as well if you want to try out a game.  Finally, they have quite a decent selection of snacks, drinks, and some beer as well should you want it.  You can open a tab and pay when you leave.
whether you identify as Penny or Sheldon you'll be able to nerd out here with some good folks,  great games and they have snacks
Always a friendly and welcoming staff as well as customers
Great game selection.  Staff is extremely knowledgeable and friendly!
Love people good selection. Most days there are people there to game a socialize with.

This awesome game shop is full of great people, helpful staff, and full inventory. They have a large following of various game players and the whole scene has always been positive, clean, sorted, and fun.
We come here several times a month for meetups. Great place to buy and play boardgames. Owner is very knowledgeable and helpful.
Cool place to be

This is a cool little shop to play cards or miniatures. They have beers on tap which is pretty awesome for meeting up with my friends and casually playing and testing new deck ideas for card games. They dont seem to have a huge competetive scene though.
Great little local gaming shop. Highly recommend it. I try to stop in there whenever I'm up in Charlotte visiting my aunt.
The owner is amazing and very helpful!!!
Cozy store with a large volume of products and still has the capacity for people to play. Definitely a nice place.
One of the better tabletop gaming places I have ever been to.  Good selection of games, great atmosphere with staff and community who are very welcoming.
This place is awesome! They have a great selection of games to buy and play and Rob, the owner, was very helpful when I was looking for some recommendations.
If you like board games or anything even slightly nerdy this is the greatest place on earth! They've got games, beer, and fun people!

The staff is always friendly, welcoming, and as helpful as they can be. New players to any tabletop games should not feel the same pressure to be immediate experts like the feeling some other local game stores provide.
Nice clean game store with.
This is a great place to purchase boardgames and a small number of boardgames.
Really nice store, helpful staff, nice prices and good environment.
very interactive owner with all customers AND THEY HAVE BEER ON TAP!
Home away from; great atmosphere and great people both staff and patrons.

Great environment for all ages. There are so many games to choose from if you're looking to stay a while. Even the owner, Rob, will come out to help show you how to play the board game you've chosen. The rest of the staff is also very friendly and helpful.There are lots of snacks, drinks, and local beer on draft.
Love it! Great people and awesome games!
Love the people who work here fun games
One of the best tabletop stores I've been in. They actually had a copy of call of cthulu!!!
Awesome local game store
Only reason it gets 4 stars is because of lack of parking. Welcoming staff and a wide variety of gamer items at reasonable prices.
Very helpful staff. They host a game night on Wednesday and everyone is friendly and tries to ensure no one gets left out of the fun.
Good place to go if your looking for games. Friendly staff, lots of tables to play on.
Friendly staff and atmosphere. Stop by and sit down to play one of the many demo games they have with nice people.
Great little store! The selection and variety is excellent. The owner is friendly and knowledgeable too. Very fair prices, and even space to play games or try out new ones.

Always a friendly place.  Try before you buy.  Have a snack and a drink.  Learn about games you are trying or might have interest in.  Everyone from the owner to the patrons wants to play games and share knowledge and ideas at this relaxing, fun game store.
Great environment to game in.
Good selection. The owner is awesome

Super friendly service, welcoming patrons, and they have demos of games available. You can try before you buy and have a pint at the same time. Does it get any better than that? It's actually a really nice perk since sometimes, games can be expensive and you want to make sure it's not too complicated or that you'll actually play it. They also remember their guests. My friend bought me a D20 spin ring and they let me bring it back for a size up, no problems at all.
Great gaming environment, kind staff, and great selection
Awesome store! They have demo games and beer on tap.
Great store.
A perfect place to go for fun, they have beer, snacks, games, friendly staff, cool people and even a smoking/vaping area outside. I love coming here to play Pathfinders!
Awesome place for those wishing to unplug and play real games!
Solid selection, friendly staff, easy to find with accessible parking.  A good fit for hardcore and casual gamers alike.

CTTG is a little out of the way for us, but worth the trip.  The owner is very friendly and knowledgeable.  I was surprised at the amount of stock he carried.  Most of the new board games were in stock, and a really nice selection of older games as well.

There's a good amount of room for in-store gaming (around 8-10 good gaming tables if I'm remembering correctly). They have snacks and drinks available for when you get hungry during a long session. And there's also a wall of demo games so you can get a feel for the games you're interested in before you buy them.

Highly recommended.
Good atmosphere, good beer
Wonderful people and excellent game selection!
Great gaming
Lots of board games, beer on tap, and could spend hours there playing any card game of your desire.
Small but welcoming... Beer on tap if you so desire. Owner very gracious as I have been there before open and invited in and stayed late finishing TI4... Wish they had more space.
Super friendly, helpful and just awesome.
Excellent selection of board games
Had a fun chat with the owner and got his assistance in buying the perfect game for a friend.
Great store. Great staff.  Great selection and beer!!
Nice selection of games. Staff was nice to me and my children. I look forward to getting to play some games here in the future.
Amazing environment! Everyone there is super nice and there are always games going on to watch or participate in. They serve snacks and refreshments too just as an added bonus.
Friendly place to buy a board game. They have many to test out and try before you buy.

The is a great variety of games and miniature paints.  The owners are super friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming.  There's a good variety of free to try games in their library and tables that expand to try them on. They also are the only game stop in town that serves local brewed craft beers.
My favorite spot in town.  I love walking up there grabbing a few beers and learning to play some new games.  Everyone there is super friendly and makes you feel welcome.
Amazing little shop!
Beer! Great games, great people, great place to just hang out and learn a new game.
Best boardgame store in Charlotte
Beer and boardgames executed well. Enough said.

Great table top game store! Great, organized selection of games, if they don't have it, they can order it for you. What sets this place apart from others is the friendly atmosphere and the fact that they serve beer, ciders and other malt liquors. They host events all the time and it's always a good time when I go.
